name: Japanese Print56
author: Vianll
description:
The
 Wikipedia Encyclepedia has a list of traditional colors used in 
Japanese art, literature, and textiles: 
(https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Traditional_colors_of_Japan). A while 
ago, I took some of these colors for clothing palettes (in the off 
chance a work of mine had a Japanese/Asian-esque culture). A while later
 I aranged them, used the palette ananlyzer, and then thought to myself 
"wow, this actually works pretty good as a pixel-art palette." Of 
course, you can be the judge of that. This palette heavily focuses on 
warm colors, as you can probably tell. I think that gives it its unique 
"texture" so to say.
